meanings.definition: a system of working hours that allows employees to choose their start and end times within a certain range.
meanings.sent1: At the office, we have flextimes, so I can start work a bit later if needed.
meanings.sent2: Many companies offer flextimes to promote work-life balance.
meanings.sent3: During the team meeting, we joked that flextimes mean we can all sleep in and still be on time.
meanings.sent4: Having flextimes is like having a magic clock that adjusts to your needs.
meanings.sent5: With flextimes, I feel more in control of my work schedule.

meanings.definition: the plural form of the word 'flextime', referring to multiple instances of flexible working hours.
meanings.sent1: In our company, flextimes are common, allowing everyone to work when they are most productive.
meanings.sent2: The HR department handles all requests related to flextimes.
meanings.sent3: We celebrated the approval of our flextimes by going out for lunch together.
meanings.sent4: To us, flextimes are like a symphony of individual schedules harmonizing together.
meanings.sent5: The team's productivity soared after implementing flextimes.
